body: I don't see any contradicting statements in docs. Could you send a pull request with proposed changes?

issue.title: Fixes docs for BaseUrl methods [skip ci] (#13821)

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | only docs bug
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | -
| Fixed issues  | #13821 

Sorry for my bad English, it's rather for clarifying my issue.

body: @samdark all right, I created pull request, but I had tried to avoid it 'cause of my bad English skills.

If it will be more clarifying, I also can create pull request with changes, that fits current documentation declaration, or create demonstrative tests (there are no any tests for `Url::previous()` as I see).
The thing is that in the end `$returnUrlParam` is used a result of calling a getter so I don't see a big issue there.

@samdark yes, but if there are no information in `$returnUrlParam`, we're expecting `null`, right? "It just using some predefined parameter name", documentation says, isn't it?
But we will receive `Yii::$app->homeUrl`, as we can see here:
https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/web/User.php#L371
It's not `null` at all. It cannot be `null`.

...Am I still unconvincing? :)
Right. Would you like to send a pull request fixing it?

@samdark if we're talking about fixing documentation to describe such (current) behavior - I'm already send one, #13836 . There are terrible English (maybe), that's why explanation is not perfect at all, and I'm ready for fixing it.
If you mean `BaseUrl::remember()` / `BaseUrl::previous()` code fix to improve it's behavior and make it matching documentation - yes, of course, I can do this. (I vote for that.)
